summary: The Home-Based Telemental Health Care Act of 2025 aims to expand mental health and substance use services in rural and underserved populations, including those in farming, fishing, and forestry. It authorizes grants to eligible telemental health providers to deliver home-based services, develop quality metrics, and support infrastructure like broadband access and patient devices. The Secretary will report on the program's impact, with up to $10 million allocated annually from 2025 to 2029.
